channel.title: News on GEONAVI LAB
channel.description: Recent content in News on GEONAVI LAB

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu is promoted to Associate Professor with tenure
item.description: Dr. Yujie Hu is promoted to Associate Professor with tenure at the University of Florida. Congratulations to Dr. Sadie Ryan and Dr. Gaby Hamerlinck, too!

item.title: Congratulations to our 2024 graduates!
item.description: We wanted to congratulate our lab members who recently graduated: Jinpeng Wang on getting a Master's Degree in Geography and Cora Crytzer on graduating Cum Laude with a Bachelors degree in Economics and a minor in Geography!

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu gave a talk at UF Epidemiology Seminar Series
item.description: Dr. Yujie Hu was invited by University of Florida's Epidemiology Department to present his research on modeling of commuting flows, travel distance, and encounter networks. Watch recording here.

item.title: The GeoNAVI lab is rocking at the 2024 AAG annual conference
item.description: Graduate students Yue Jing, Md. Shaharier Alam, Jinpeng Wang, and Zeyu He present at the 2024 AAG annual conference in Hawaii.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu guest-edits the "Sustainable transportation and mobility solutions" collection in Scientific Reports
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu serves as a guest editor for the "Sustainable transportation and mobility solutions" collection in the journal Scientific Reports. 

Research into sustainable transportation and mobility solutions can help to reduce the negative environmental and social impacts associated with current transportation systems. Key factors are the promotion of energy efficiency, emission reduction, and improved accessibility. Intelligent transportation systems and smart city technologies are utilized to optimize traffic flow and reduce congestion. Increased reliance on public transportation rather than private methods, policies aiming to encourage active modes of transport (such as walking or cycling) and use of low-emission vehicles in place of older high-emission machines help to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve the quality of life for communities.

item.title: Congratulations to our 2023 graduates!
item.description: We wanted to congratulate our lab members who recently graduated: Cade Gouin on getting a Master's Degree in Geography and Finn Rimay on getting his Bachelors degree in Microbiology and Cell Science and graduating Summa Cum Laude with highest distinction!

item.title: New NSF grant to study human movement dynamics under hurricane threats
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu and collaborators Dr. Leo Duan and Dr. George Michailidis have received a new grant from the National Science Foundation to conduct geospatial modeling and risk mitigation for human movement dynamics under hurricane threats.

More information about the project can be found here.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu joins the Editorial Board of Scientific Reports
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu joins the Editorial Board of Scientific Reports.

Scientific Reports is an open access journal publishing original research from across all areas of the natural sciences, psychology, medicine and engineering.

More details about the journal can be found here.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu talks about commuting in the age of rising costs with WUSF Public Media
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu was featured on the latest coverage Lack of affordable homes means longer commute times for more people in the Tampa metro area by Gabriella Paul at WUSF News.

Read the coverage here.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu joins the Editorial Board of Computers, Environment and Urban Systems
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu joins the Editorial Board of Computers, Environment and Urban Systems.

Computers, Environment and Urban Systems is an interdisciplinary journal publishing cutting-edge and innovative computer-based research on urban systems, systems of cities, and built and natural environments , that privileges the geospatial perspective. The journal provides a stimulating presentation of perspectives, research developments, overviews of important new technologies and uses of major computational, information-based, and visualization innovations. Applied and theoretical contributions demonstrate the scope of computer-based analysis fostering a better understanding of urban systems, the synergistic relationships between built and natural environments, their spatial scope and their dynamics.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu gave a talk at FSU Geography Colloquium Series
item.description: Dr. Yujie Hu was invited by Florida State University’s Geography Department to present his research on constructing optimal geographic units for health care markets.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu presented at UFII COVID-19 SEED Awardees Virtual Seminar Series
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu was invited by UF Informatics Institute to present some preliminary findings from his funded project examining the impacts of COVID-19 on crime patterns.

Refer to this link for a brief summary of the results and this link for his presentation.

item.title: Meet the Geographer: Dr. Yujie Hu
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu was recently interviewed by UF Geography Department about how he got interested in Transportation Geography, networks, and GIS! Thanks to Mike Simonovich for interviewing!

Refer to this link for more detail.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu awarded the UFII COVID-19 Response SEED Funding
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu is awarded the COVID-19 Response SEED Funding from UFII (UF Informatics Institute). This competitive research award provides seed money for applications for data science, machine learning, AI, and mathematical modeling related research that can be rapidly mobilized to help address various facets of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Dr. Hu and his collaborator will be examining the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on crimes. His team is looking for two student OPS positions (undergrad or grad) to contribute to this project. Refer to this link for more detail about the positions and how to apply.

item.title: Dr. Yujie Hu awarded the Ralph E. Powe Junior Faculty Enhancement Awards
item.description:
Dr. Yujie Hu is awarded the Ralph E. Powe Junior Faculty Enhancement Awards from ORAU (Oak Ridge Associated Universities). This competitive research award provides seed money for junior faculty members that often result in additional funding from other sources.

Read more at: ORAU
